result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickie A Staab was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs will be paid from the defendant's bond.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety and probation shall monitor at the highest level.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo anger management counseling at the discretion of probation.  Defendant shall undergo any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall complete his GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult Diploma Academy at the discretion of probation.     Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Huber and Good time granted.  
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation

Defendant Rickie A Staab in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court finds defendant guilty. Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by victim.  Statement by Attorney Paul.   Court orders withheld sentence probation for two years conditions of court costs, DNA sample and surcharge on count 1; letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation; anger management counseling at probation's discretion; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; AODA and follow through with treatment; complete GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult Diploma Academy: absolute sobriety test and administer at the highest level that probation has for example sober link.  The $1,000.00 cash bond posted in 16CM145 shall be used towards the costs in 16CM86.  Case No. 16CM145 dismissed and read in.  Check into jail sentence credit. - rt
Bail/bond hearing on February 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on January 10, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

ADR began at 11:01  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rickie A. Staab appeared in person, in custody.  Mr. Staab is in court for a bond hearing for new charges.  Attorney Tlusty requested that the court order the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in this case.  The court ordered the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in this case.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Attorney Shawn M Paul in court on authorization.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE waives reading of complaint and enters a plea of not guilty. Court orders a $500.00 cash bond with booking. No objection. DE is ordered to appear within 48 hours to sign bond and report to jail for booking. Pretrial conference scheduled for 12-01-16 at 9:00 a.m. ap
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
